com.interfaces.robotstories

Class create_robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.interfaces.robotstories.create_robot

  • public class create_robot
extends Activity
    Interface to create or modify the properties of a robot

    Creates an axuliar robot if there is no one created previously to be able to call the methods to know the number of motors and sensors

    .

    can't go to anywhere until all the data are saved correctly

    PROBLEM: If you create motors/sensor but don't save the robot, touching the return button of the tablet the created motors/sensors disapear, the reason for that is that you modify the play here, and you have to come back properly to save the changes

    Same problem for deleting motors

    Author:
    Arturo Gil

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void addRow(int id_table, java.lang.String[] portsNumbers)
      Add row whit the new motor/sensor, add the delete button to row
      protected void deleteRow(java.lang.String name, TableRow tr)
      Delete a row from the table of available motors/sensor and remove the motor/sensor from the play.
      private void iniLayout()
      Reads play and previous activity, if this values are null, finish the activity Set previous defined values in their places (if we come to modify a robot) Creates a new robot if doesn't exists
      protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Add listeners to buttons, and calls to iniLayout
      protected Dialog onCreateDialog(int id, Bundle args)
      Create dialog for input data for sensor and for motors
      private void saveAndGo()
      Save all the data and come back to the previous activity.
      protected void saveInputDataDialog(int id, EditText nameET)
      Check if the name is already in use by another motor or sensor (respectively) or if it null-> show toast if not save input data from the dialog -> save + add row
      private boolean saveMotors()
      Save the motors in their respective ports in the robot if there is any problem at the time of save any motor, return false alright returns true VERY FRAGILE METHOD, IF YOU MAKE ANY CHANGE IN THE TABLE, PLEASE CHECK IF THERE IS ANY NEED OF CHANGING THE VALUE OF POS_SPINNER_ON_ROW, AND POS_TV_ON_ROW
      private boolean saveSensors()
      Save the sensors in their respective ports in the robot if there is any problem at the time of save any sensor, return false alright returns true VERY FRAGILE METHOD, IF YOU MAKE ANY CHANGE IN THE TABLE, PLEASE CHECK IF THERE IS ANY NEED OF CHANGING THE VALUE OF POS_SPINNER_ON_ROW, AND POS_TV_ON_ROW

    • Field Detail

      • MOTOR_DIALOG

        private static final int MOTOR_DIALOG
        The value of this constant is 0. It is the code to call the dialog for defining a motor
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SENSOR_DIALOG

        private static final int SENSOR_DIALOG
        The value of this constant is 1. It is the code to call the dialog for defining a sensor
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • POS_SPINNER_ON_ROW

        private static final int POS_SPINNER_ON_ROW
        POSITION OF THE SPINNER IN TABLE ROW. The value of this constant is 2. (necessary in save motor/sensor, because it needs to know where it is to read its value)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • POS_TV_ON_ROW

        private static final int POS_TV_ON_ROW
        POSITION OF THE TV OF THE NAME OF THE MOTOR/SENSOR IN TABLE ROW. The value of this constant is 0. (necessary in save motor/sensor, because it needs to know where it is to read its value)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Add listeners to buttons, and calls to iniLayout

      • iniLayout

        private void iniLayout()
        Reads play and previous activity, if this values are null, finish the activity Set previous defined values in their places (if we come to modify a robot) Creates a new robot if doesn't exists

      • saveAndGo

        private void saveAndGo()
        Save all the data and come back to the previous activity. Checks if there are more than one motor/sensor per port

      • saveSensors

        private boolean saveSensors()
        Save the sensors in their respective ports in the robot if there is any problem at the time of save any sensor, return false alright returns true

        VERY FRAGILE METHOD, IF YOU MAKE ANY CHANGE IN THE TABLE, PLEASE CHECK IF THERE IS ANY NEED OF CHANGING THE VALUE OF POS_SPINNER_ON_ROW, AND POS_TV_ON_ROW

      • saveMotors

        private boolean saveMotors()
        Save the motors in their respective ports in the robot if there is any problem at the time of save any motor, return false alright returns true

        VERY FRAGILE METHOD, IF YOU MAKE ANY CHANGE IN THE TABLE, PLEASE CHECK IF THERE IS ANY NEED OF CHANGING THE VALUE OF POS_SPINNER_ON_ROW, AND POS_TV_ON_ROW

      • onCreateDialog

        protected Dialog onCreateDialog(int id,
                                Bundle args)
        Create dialog for input data for sensor and for motors
        Parameters:
        id - of the dialog to show (motor or sensor)

      • saveInputDataDialog

        protected void saveInputDataDialog(int id,
                                   EditText nameET)
        Check if the name is already in use by another motor or sensor (respectively) or if it null-> show toast if not save input data from the dialog -> save + add row
        Parameters:
        id - case motor/sensor
        nameET - place to read the name of the motor/sensor

      • addRow

        protected void addRow(int id_table,
                      java.lang.String[] portsNumbers)
        Add row whit the new motor/sensor, add the delete button to row
        Parameters:
        id_table - case motor/sensor
        portsNumbers - array for the spinner whit the number of the ports

      • deleteRow

        protected void deleteRow(java.lang.String name,
                         TableRow tr)
        Delete a row from the table of available motors/sensor and remove the motor/sensor from the play. Reads if it is motor or sensor taking the parent of the tableRow, it is the TableLayout, and sees if its id is from motor or sensor Use the tablelayout to delete the row from it
        Parameters:
        name - of the motor/sensor
        tr - where the motor/sensor is
